The ultimate realisation of Africa’s full potential is dependent on the easing of movement of goods, services and human capital across the entire length and breadth of the continent. Indeed it is an important prerequisite for peace and stability to prevail.

The Agreement sets up an EPA Council that will address implementation issues. It will be reviewed every five years./13
Agreement has inbuilt safeguards on various sensitive products, for example it excludes from liberalisation various agric products./12
The remainder will be progressively liberalised within 15 years from the moment the EPA enters into force./11
Through the Agreement the EAC has committed to liberalise the equivalent of 82.6% of imports from the EU by value./10
It guarantees that the EU will not apply export subsidies on products destined for the EAC market./9
It also creates new regional opportunities through more flexible rules of origin and cumulation framework./8
The agreement provides duty- and quota-free access for Kenyan and EAC products to the EU market./7
The agreement covers trade in goods and development cooperation. It also contains chapters on agriculture, fisheries and economic dev./6
Negotiations of the EAC-EU EPA were concluded by both sides and the text initialled on October 14, 2014. /5
This governs the EU preferential market access regime for African, Caribbean and Pacific countries that have negotiated EPAs with EU./4
With the ratification of the Agreement, Kenya will continue to benefit from EC Market Access Regulation No 1528/2007./3
Handing over ceremony was witnessed by Mme Alda Silveira Reis, Director of Trade, Devel’nt, Horizontal Issues & Foreign Affairs Council./2
Kenya through its Mission to the EU in Brussels yesterday deposited the instruments of ratification of the EAC-EU Partnership Agreement./1

South Africa will grant long term visas, including residency, to skilled workers from Kenya needing to work in the country. /8
Turnaround time for processing visas for ordinary Kenyans will be five working days with a cost element of $47 to VFS, processing firm. /7
South Africa to issue a 3-year multiple journey visa to Kenyan business people that frequently travel to the country. /6
Kenyan students studying in South Africa will henceforth be issued with a 5-year study visa covering the entire duration of Study. /5
Kenyans residing in neighbouring countries of S. Africa will be issued multiple entry visas as opposed to current single entry. /4
South Africa has agree to remove transit visa requirement for Kenyans going through its ports to neighbouring countries. /3

Kenya and South Africa have today agreed of a raft of measures that will ease visa requirements for nationals of the two countries. /1
